name: bioscope
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an old word for a film camera or film projector (= a device for showing films on a screen): There are instructions for making your own simple bioscope.
undefined undefined/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
(also bioscope show) in the past, an entertainment consisting of a film show that travelled from place to place : The heyday of the Bioscope was from the late 1890s until World War I.
mainly South African a cinema: There wasn’t much to do in George itself except visit the local cinema, known for some obscure reason as the "bioscope".
mainly Indian English a film: I told him I would get a thousand rupees when the bioscope I was in was released.
More examplesFewer examplesA bioscope is a movie camera belonging to an earlier era, before digitalization.He made a documentary about a travelling bioscope projectionist in India. His bioscope show was on the Yorkshire fair circuit.It was his view that for the person "in search of different phases of human nature there is no better place to find objects of study than to visit a bioscope show".He's like someone you'd see in a bioscope drama.
